statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Drexel 56, Ball State 51
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Dominick Mejia led four players in double figures with 14 points and hit four 3-pointers to lead Drexel to a 56-51 win over Ball State on Tuesday night. The Dragons (7-5) won their fourth straight game. Bashir Mason sealed the win with a steal, a drive down the court and a layup to put the Dragons ahead 54-48 with 27 seconds left. Mason scored 13 points for Drexel. Frank Elegar and Randy Hampton each added 10 points for the Dragons. Ball State (4-3) only trailed 45-43 after a dunk by Charles Bass with 7:08 remaining in the game. But the Cardinals failed to score over the next 4:14. The Cardinals shot only 34 percent from the field. After leading by as many as seven in the first half, Ball State went scoreless for a stretch of 6:19. Drexel took advantage as they scored 13 straight points. Hampton capped off the run with a 3-pointer to give the Dragons a 25-19 lead with 4:18 remaining. Drexel never trailed from that point on. Skip Mills hit a 3-pointer with 2:25 left in the first half to tie the game at 27-27, but Drexel scored the final four points of the half to lead 31-27 at halftime. Mills led the Cardinals with a game-high 18 points. Maurice Acker added 12 points for Ball State.
